jobDescription: Istation is a leading developer and publisher of educational software for prekindergarten through 8th grade students and educators. Istation’s interactive, internet- and web-based instructional programs include computer-adaptive assessments and intervention programs in the areas of reading, math, Spanish, and interdisciplinary studies, and they are currently being used in 40 states and seven countries.  We are looking for a passionate ISIP™ Engineer, better known as an Assessment Data Analyst. Ideal candidates will have a strong academic background as well as technical skills in applied statistics, machine learning, data mining, and software development. Familiarity with big data techniques and working with large-scale data sets would be a plus. The successful candidate will primarily write programs that will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into client business communication. This role requires a highly skilled, highly analytical programmer with a knack for analysis, math, and statistics. Critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and a passion for machine learning and research are essential for this role.  The role is perfect for you if you are someone who works well independently and in a team and you have very strong programming experience, advanced analytics, drive, curiosity, and exceptional communication skills. Although you may be primarily writing programs, you know how to rise above the numbers and explain the essential insights to the general business user. While you rely on data to prove your point, you love to think outside the box and solve problems creatively. You have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.  As part of this role, you will be encouraged and expected to keep your advanced-analytics skills sharp and current. You will have the opportunity to work the full development life cycle of putting analytics solutions into production.
